item.description:
Don't miss joining us as we welcome back special guest Ben Falk of Whole Systems Research Farm in Vermont on the eve of the publication of his new book, The Resilient Farm and Homestead. Those of you who attended his talk last year know that he's an excellent speaker and he will be building on that material with new insights this time around.  No matter what size your current home or property, you will come away inspired with new ideas and techniques.

Ben will present an image and illustration-filled tour of his homestead design principles and their application to achieve a highly diverse, nutrient-dense food, medicine, and fuel-producing homestead. Beyond sharing his compelling philosophy of designing for resilience, Ben will cover topics such as rapid fuel wood production in black locust hedgerows, integrating livestock with perennial woody crops, wood-heating hot water, rice paddy construction and management, earthworks for drought and flood prevention and much more.

Potluck supper at 6:30 (see below) followed by the Presentation.

This event is co-sponsored by Maine Organic Farmers and Gardeners Association (MOFGA)

Ben hails from the Mad River Valley and his hillside farm is headquarters for ongoing research and development into low/no input perennial farm systems development and represents one site among a growing handful of properties in our network where ecosystem agriculture projects are maintained, harvested from, observed, recorded and shared. This is one the best examples in our region of a fully-designed and established early stage permaculture farm.

Cosponsored by The Resilience Hub, The Maine Food Strategy and the New England Environmental Finance Center at USM's Muskie School of Public Service. http://vimeo.com/33919587

SPACE IS LIMITED!  $10 covers event costs. Contact us if you would prefer to pay using one of your time dollars (for Hour Exchange members).

6:30 Potluck Supper (bring a dish/beverage to share and your own potluck kit [dish/bowl/utensils/napkin/cup for a zero waste event])

7:00 Announcements + Presentation

8:00 Questions/Discussion

8:30 Wrap-up + Social Time

 

More about Ben:

Ben Falk, M.A.L.D: Design, Project Strategy, Systems Optimizer

Ben developed Whole Systems Design, LLC as a land-based response to biological and cultural extinction and the increasing separation between people and elemental things. Life as a designer, builder, ecologist, tree-tender, and backcountry traveler continually informs Ben’s integrative approach to developing landscapes and buildings. His home landscape and the WSD studio site in Vermont's Mad River Valley serve as a proving ground for the innovative land developments featured in the projects of Whole Systems Design. Ben has studied architecture and landscape architecture at the graduate level and holds a master’s degree in land-use planning and design. He has taught design courses at the University of Vermont and Harvard’s Arnold Arboretum as well as on permaculture design, microclimate design, and design for climate change.  He serves on the Board of Directors and Faculty at the Yestermorrow Design-Build School.

And a fun little piece from Fast Company:  http://www.fastcompany.com/magazine/125/promised-land.html
